meanings.sent1: Her pulchritudes were admired by everyone at the party.
meanings.sent2: The garden was filled with colorful flowers, adding pulchritudes to the surroundings.
meanings.sent3: The pulchritudes of the sunset painted the sky in a mesmerizing way.
meanings.sent4: The artist captured the pulchritudes of nature in his masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The pulchritudes of the mountain range took my breath away.

meanings.definition: A beautiful or attractive quality or feature.
meanings.sent1: The pulchritudes of her smile brightened up the room.
meanings.sent2: The old mansion had many architectural pulchritudes that fascinated visitors.
meanings.sent3: His sense of humor added pulchritudes to their conversation.
meanings.sent4: The book described the pulchritudes of the enchanted forest in vivid detail.
meanings.sent5: The pulchritudes of the melody lingered in the air long after the music stopped.
